thread.title: 26 Celebrities On Their Very First Oscars Red Carpet
thread.title_full: 26 Celebrities On Their Very First Oscars Red Carpet

author: Lindsay Farber
title: 26 Celebrities On Their Very First Oscars Red Carpet
text: Age: 29 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, The Deer Hunter #Fact: After her first win, Meryl would eventually be nominated 19 more times, and win two more Oscars. As of now, she is the most nominated actress in history. That being said, Katharine Hepburn still holds the highest number of Oscar wins (four of them), compared to Meryl’s three. This year she’s nominated for Best Actress for Florence Foster Jenkins . ID: 10595307 2. Drew Barrymore — 1983 View this image › Bertrand Rindoff Petroff / Getty Images Age: 8 Winner: Best Picture, E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial #Fact: While Drew herself wasn’t nominated for an Academy Award, E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial ended up taking home an Oscar. Drew walked the carpet in a dress designed by her mom, and wore a string of pearls given to her by Steven Spielberg. How sweet! ID: 10594926 3. Angelina Jolie — 1986 View this image › Ron Galella / WireImage Age: 10 #Fact: Angelina walked the carpet with her father, Jon Voight, who was nominated for Best Actor in Runaway Train , and she would soon follow suit. In 2000 she won Best Supporting Actress for Girl, Interrupted , and was nominated for Best Supporting Actress in 2009 for Changeling . Additionally, she won the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award in 2013. ID: 10594867 4. Julia Roberts and Kiefer Sutherland— 1990 View this image › Ron Galella / WireImage Ages: 22 and 23 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, Steel Magnolias #Fact: This one’s juicy. Soooo, Julia and Kiefer met on the set of Flatliners , and they eventually fell in love IRL. The problem was, Julia was already engaged to Dylan McDermott, who played her husband in Steel Magnolias . Kiefer was married to his first wife, Camelia Kath. Kiefer’s divorce was finalized in early 1990 and Julia and Kiefer got engaged the same year this photo was taken. But it’s not over yet! Julia called off the wedding in 1991, just days before she was supposed to walk down the aisle. YIKES. ID: 10594871 5. Denzel Washington — 1990 View this image › Ron Galella / WireImage Age: 35 Winner: Best Supporting Actor, Glory #Fact: In addition to his Glory win, Denzel took home an Oscar in 2002 for Best Actor in Training Day . He’s been nominated a total of eight times, including two nominations this year — Best Actor and Best Picture for Fences . ID: 10594885 6. Juliette Lewis and Brad Pitt — 1992 View this image › Jim Smeal / WireImage Ages: 18 and 28 #Fact: Brad’s been nominated a total of six times, winning one Oscar in 2014 for Best Picture, 12 Years a Slave . As for Brad and Juliette — they started dating after meeting on the set of Too Young to Die? in 1990 and eventually split after four years. ID: 10594875 7. Leonardo DiCaprio — 1994 View this image › Barry King / WireImage Age: 19 Nominee: Best Supporting Actor, What’s Eating Gilbert Grape #Fact: Leo was nominated for his first of six Academy Awards, eventually winning in 2016 for Best Actor in The Revenant. ID: 10594861 8. Gwyneth Paltrow — 1994 View this image › Ron Galella / WireImage Age: 21 #Fact: Gwyneth is posing here with James Ivory who was her director on the film Jefferson in Paris . After this photo was taken, Gwyneth and Brad Pitt would soon start their three-year-long relationship after meeting on the set of Se7en . ID: 10594868 9. Halle Berry — 1996 View this image › http:// Kevin.mazur / WireImage Age: 29 #Fact: Ten days prior to walking the carpet, Halle’s new movie Executive Decision with Kurt Russell and Steven Seagal was released. ID: 10594870 10. Kate Winslet — 1996 View this image › Vince Bucci / AFP / Getty Images Age: 20 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, Sense and Sensibility #Fact: Kate has been nominated for an Academy Award a total of seven times, winning in 2009 for Best Actress in The Reader . During the time of this photo, Kate was working on Titanic which was released the following year in 1997. Gotta wonder if she had any clue how successful it’d be? ID: 10594854 11. Jennifer Lopez — 1997 View this image › Jim Smeal / WireImage Age: 27 #Fact: Jennifer is pictured here with her husband of one month, Ojani Noa, though the couple split the following year. Days before walking the carpet, Jennifer’s iconic movie Selena was released. Rumors circulated that there was tension between J.Lo and Salma Hayek (below) after Salma claimed that she was offered the role of Selena. In 1998, J.Lo called Salma a liar and said she was never offered the role. “It makes me laugh when she says she got offered Selena,” J.Lo said , “which was an outright lie. If that’s what she does to get herself publicity, then that’s her thing.” Damn. ID: 10594843 12. Salma Hayek — 1997 View this image › Russell Einhorn / Getty Images Age: 30 #Fact: Salma walked the carpet arm-in-arm with singer Luis Miguel. Tensions were apparently high between her and J.Lo regarding Selena at this time, though Salma denied any sort of feud. In 2003, she took home the Academy Award for Best Actress in Frida . ID: 10594841 13. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon — 1998 View this image › Vince Bucci / AFP / Getty Images Age: 25 and 27 Winner: Best Original Screenplay, Good Will Hunting #Fact: Childhood friends Ben and Matt both brought their moms to the red carpet and had one of the most adorable acceptance speeches to ever exist. Matt would eventually be nominated four more times, and Ben twice, winning Best Picture in 2013 for Argo . ID: 10594878 14. Cameron Diaz — 1998 View this image › Jim Smeal / WireImage Age: 25 #Fact: At her first Oscars, Cameron walked the carpet with her then-boyfriend, Matt Dillon. It was a big year for Cameron, as her film There’s Something About Mary was released just a few months later. ID: 10594858 15. Renée Zellweger — 1999 View this image › Vince Bucci / AFP / Getty Images Age: 29 #Fact: Renée has been nominated a total of three times, taking home an Oscar in 2004 for Best Supporting Actress in Cold Mountain . ID: 10594853 16. Kate Hudson — 2001 View this image › Getty Images Age: 21 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, Almost Famous #Fact: At the time of this photo, Kate had just married The Black Crowes frontman, Chris Robinson, less than two months prior. The couple unfortunately split in 2007. ID: 10594876 17. Reese Witherspoon and Ryan Phillippe — 2002 View this image › Lucy Nicholson / AFP / Getty Images Age: 26 and 27 #Fact: While they’re no longer together, Reese and Ryan had been married for three years at the time of this photo. In 2006, Reese won Best Actress for her role in Walk the Line , and was also nominated in 2015 for Wild . ID: 10594857 18. Scarlett Johansson — 2004 View this image › Frank Micelotta / Getty Images Age: 19 #Fact: In 2003, Scarlett’s films Lost in Translation and Girl with a Pearl Earring had been released. She has surprisingly never been nominated for an Oscar. ID: 10594877 19. Beyoncé — 2005 View this image › Carlo Allegri / Getty Images Age: 23 #Fact: Back in 2005, Beyoncé performed “Vois Sur Ton Chemin” from Les Choristes at the Oscars. She also sang Phantom of the Opera’s “Learn to Be Lonely” with composer Andrew Lloyd Webber and did a duet of “Believe” from The Polar Express with Josh Groban. Damn, Bey. ID: 10595187 20. George Clooney — 2006 View this image › Frazer Harrison / Getty Images Age: 44 Winner: Best Supporting Actor, Syriana Nominee: Best Director and Best Original Screenplay, Good Night, and Good Luck #Fact: George has been nominated for an Academy Award a total of eight times. In addition to his Syriana win, he won Best Picture in 2013 for Argo . ID: 10594883 21. Jennifer Aniston — 2006 View this image › Chris Polk / FilmMagic Age: 36 #Fact: Jen hasn’t been nominated for an Academy Award, however she’s been nominated three times for a Golden Globe, winning in 2003 for Friends . ID: 10594873 22. Amy Adams — 2006 View this image › Jeff Haynes / AFP / Getty Images Age: 31 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, Junebug #Fact: Amy has been up for an Oscar five separate times for her work in Junebug (2005), Doubt (2008), The Fighter (2010), The Master (2012), and American Hustle (2013). ID: 10594917 23. Anne Hathaway — 2007 View this image › Frazer Harrison / Getty Images Age: 24 #Fact: While Anne wasn’t nominated this year, Patricia Field won Best Costume Design for The Devil Wears Prada . In 2009, Anne was nominated for Best Actress in Rachel Getting Married . She won Best Actress in 2013 for Les Misérables . ID: 10594852 24. Viola Davis — 2009 View this image › Frazer Harrison / Getty Images Age: 43 Nominee: Best Supporting Actress, Doubt #Fact: In 2012, Viola was again nominated, this time for Best Actress in The Help . This year, she’s up for Best Supporting Actress for Fences . ID: 10594916 25. Jennifer Lawrence — 2011 View this image › Robyn Beck / AFP / Getty Images Age: 20 Nominee: Best Actress, Winter’s Bone #Fact: Jennifer was later nominated in 2014 for Best Supporting Actress in American Hustle and 2016 for Best Actress in Joy . In 2013, she won her first Oscar for Best Actress in Silver Lining’s Playbook . ID: 10594860 26. Emma Stone — 2012 View this image › Michael Buckner / Getty Images Age: 23 #Fact: Emma wasn’t up for an award in 2012, but in 2015 she was nominated for Best Actress in Birdman . This year (2017) she’s up for Best Actress for La La Land . ID: 10594925
